abstract: United Automobile Workers union says Chrysler employees approve four-year agreement; about 55 percent of firm's 23,000 hourly workers vote in favor of contract, which promises 2,100 new jobs in United States.
snippet: Union officials said about 55 percent of the automaker’s 23,000 hourly workers backed a contract that would add jobs in the United States.
lead_paragraph: Union officials said about 55 percent of the automaker’s 23,000 hourly workers backed a contract that would add jobs in the United States.

headline.main: Chrysler Workers Approve Pact That Adds 2,100 U.S. Jobs
headline.print_headline: Chrysler Workers Approve Pact That Adds 2,100 U.S. Jobs
headline.seo: Chrysler Workers Approve Pact That Adds 2,100 Jobs
